website_summaries.verdict: Some cyclists require top-notch breathability and comfort in their footwear. Then some look for a shoe with a unique style and can be used in different biking pursuits. Good thing the Republic R Knit by Giro provides all these.That said, a few minor misfires have been reported, albeit very subjective ones. To conclude, the Giro Republic R Knit is a gear powerhouse, even with the minor issues mentioned.
pros: Dozens of reviewers, including cycling bloggers, laud the Giro Republic R Knit for having great ventilation
This road cycling shoe's comfort has deeply delighted most of its wearers
Many owners give this shoe top marks for its lightweight feel
The Republic R Knit stuns several consumers with its unique and sleek aesthetic
Cycling enthusiasts praise the footgear's supportive feel
Some wearers applaud the quick-drying materials of the shoe
The quality of the craftsmanship and materials used have wowed some testers
cons: Some users gripe about how laces take a bit longer to put on compared to other closure types
A couple of riders who require super-stiff soles find this pair's to be quite flexible

customer_reviews.title: really great city, long weekend, hard workout shoe
customer_reviews.text: really great shoe! not narrow for a normal foot. if you buy wide shoes then buy wide bike shoes. you can see thru the mesh, thats how airy they are. the inside is swede and breaks in very nice. i wore 2 pairs of wet sox the first 2 rides to break them in and just sweat after that, about 150 miles and they disappear from your feet. there is a strap on the tounge for the lace loops, but tucking in is just as comfy. if ur on the the fence, get them and ull be happy, true to size btw. im always an 11.5, got a 46, perf.
customer_reviews.author: April Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I ride these any time I'm on my endurance road bike, whether commuting to work or on a 60 mile fun ride. The quality is great, they are much more breathable than shoes with a solid upper, and are of course walkable. I bought a half size larger than a perfect fit for me so I have room for thick wool socks in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Rambling idiot

customer_reviews.title: It’s alright thus far
customer_reviews.text: Shoes look good, not as awesome as the Empire but they are a good looking shoe. Found the carbon plate to be pretty stiff and didn’t notice much flex while pedaling. After about 10 miles started developing hot spots and around 18 miles I started to develop foot pain. I believe the foot api. Can be alleviated by changing out the insole. Very breathable.
customer_reviews.author: Tamudawson

customer_reviews.title: Where these shoes for +200 miles to break in
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes to use even when it’s rajning. I’ve used these bows when it’s been raining , hot or snow. They are amIng to use and hard to break in.
customer_reviews.author: FelineLuvr

customer_reviews.title: Light and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The Giro Knit's are the lightest, most comfortable cycling shoes I've ever owned. Being a lace up they're not quite as snug as a Boa shoe but I'll give that up in favor of the impressive lack of weight here. I like that the metal cleat doesn't grind when I'm walking around town in these. Great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable - when you find the right size
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have been great so far. Comfortable, quick drying, and look good too. I would say that the size chart is bogus. Order 2-3 sizes up or they won’t fit. It’s my only gripe.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Johns

customer_reviews.title: Fashionable, comfortable, cool, great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Very fashionable, comfortable, cool as they breathe. I am able to walk in and out of my house with no ground contact from the cleat. Great show so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Moulton

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable Biking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Like another reviewer, my feet have had a hard existence. Left foot has had 3 broken bones, right only one. It is hard for me to find a comfortable shoe, much less a biking shoe. But, these are very comfortable. The upper is breathable and conform to your foot. Better for hot, warm temperatures -- the ventilation is great. Using with Shimano PD-M520L MTB pedals on a road bike.
customer_reviews.author: veneilijä

customer_reviews.title: Great Spin Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for use with a spin bike (a real spin bike)...nice and stiff for good power transfer
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Alabastro

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to find consistent sizing in shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Measured 45 at LBS. These were 46 and fit but a bit narrow. Got stretch devices to widen.
customer_reviews.author: Will M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Cycling Shoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes after weeks of research online and in stores trying different brands and sizes on. They ran a tad small/narrow as I am a US SZ12 which translates to a 46 but I had to go with a 47. I have about 100 miles on them in the last week and they have been great. In addition GIRO has a fit guarantee so you can exchange them if they don't fit you properly.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Size up if you have wide feet
customer_reviews.text: Very good shoe. A bit tight on my wide 10.5 feet. I bought a size 44 but I wish I went with the size 45.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Tutton

product_meta.title: Giro Republic R Knit Road, Unisex Cycling Shoes
product_meta.description: STYLE FOR MILES WITH CO-MOLDED DURABILITY The Republic R Knit offers undeniable style with our new engineered Xnetic Knit upper which was developed for the specific needs of a cyclist An internal TPU skeletal system provides support where you need it while the knit offers suppleness for superior sock-like comfort The upper is DWR-treated for water repellency and easy cleaning and a rubber toe guard and bonded TPU heel increase durability and abrasion resistance A new nylon and rubber co-molded outsole provides improved durability and better traction for stable footing on roads sidewalks and gravel when you're off the bike UPPER Engineered Xnetic Knit upper Bonded TPU skeletal support structure Rubber toe guard DWR treated Reflective Empire laces hold a knot durable and light OUTSOLE Co-molded nylon and rubber outsole with 2-bolt cleat mount Mid-foot scuff guard FOOTBED Molded EVA footbed with microsuede top sheet and medium arch support Anti-microbial treatment WEIGHT 310 grams (size 42)
feature_bullets: STYLE FOR MILES WITH CO-MOLDED DURABILITY The Republic R Knit offers undeniable style with our new engineered Xnetic Knit upper which was developed for the specific needs of a cyclist
UPPER Engineered Xnetic Knit upper Bonded TPU skeletal support structure Rubber toe guard DWR treated Reflective Empire laces hold a knot durable and light
OUTSOLE Co-molded nylon and rubber outsole with 2-bolt cleat mount Mid-foot scuff guard
FOOTBED Molded EVA footbed with microsuede top sheet and medium arch support Anti-microbial treatment
